metadata.Title: CVE-2016-10094 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Off-by-one error in the t2p_readwrite_pdf_image_tile function in tools/tiff2pdf.c in LibTIFF 4.0.7 allows remote attackers to have unspecified impact via a crafted image.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10094` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.6
libtiff-tools - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.6
libtiff5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.6
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.6
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> reproducer: https://github.com/asarubbo/poc/blob/master/00112-libtiff-heapoverflow-_TIFFmemcpy this will not be fixed in precise/esm

criterions.comment: tiff package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.3-7ubuntu0.6').
